Content: 2*p61166a0228*leave blank 1. a cyclist and his bicycle have a total mass of 75 kg.  the cyclist is moving down a straight road that is inclined at an angle į to the horizontal, where sin į = 115 the cyclist is working at a constant rate of 56 w.  the magnitude of the resistance to motion is modelled as a constant force of magnitude 40 n.  at the instant when the speed of the cyclist is v m s–1, his acceleration is 13  m s–2 find the value of v.(5)

6*p61166a0628*leave blank 3.6 m s–124  nsp60qfigure 2 a particle p of mass 0.75 kg is moving along a straight line on a horizontal surface.  at the instant when the speed of p is 6 m s–1, it receives an impulse of magnitude  24 ns. the impulse acts in the plane of the horizontal surface.  at the instant when p receives the impulse, the line of action of the impulse makes an angle of 60q with the direction of motion of p, as shown in figure 2. find (i) the speed of p immediately after receiving the impulse, (ii) the size of the angle between the direction of motion of p immediately before receiving the impulse and the direction of motion of p immediately after receiving the impulse.(7)
